description: Late-Iron Age to Roman rural settlement, odd shaped pits and an enclosure were interpreted as a possible ritual focus by report authors. Though little evidence to base this on.
bibliography: Friendship-Taylor. “Iron Age and Roman Quinton: The Evidence for the Ritual Use of the Site (Site E 1978-1981).” Upper Nene Archaeological Society Fascicule 5 (1999).
———. “The Excavation of the Belgic and Romano-British Settlement at Quinton, Northamptonshire: Site B. (1973-7).” Northamptonshire Archaeology 13 (1979).
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Quinton (Northamptonshire).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
